dialogs.text: The image on the cover of this book is of its author - Amanda Smith (1837-1915).
dialogs.answer: Amanda Berry Smith was one of the few women evangelists to leave a personal account of her work. She was born to slave parents in 1837 in Maryland. Her father, Samuel Berry, earned enough money to purchase freedom for himself, his wife, and their five children. They moved to Pennsylvania, where their home became a station on the Underground Railroad.

dialogs.text: The frontpiece of the book is the portrait of Amanda Smith.
dialogs.answer: Amanda Smith was a Methodist preacher and former slave who funded The Amanda Smith Orphanage and Industrial Home for Abandoned and Destitute Colored Children outside Chicago.
Text on the spine: "Amanda Smith's own story".

Title: 'An Autobiography: The Story of the Lord's Dealings with Mrs. Amanda Smith, the Colored Evangelist: Containing an Account of Her Life Work of Faith, and Her Travels in America, England, Ireland, Scotland, India, and Africa as an Independent Missionary'.
